Title of the Analytics tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Analytics tab in OrgCheck
Description / Help text of the Analytics tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page lists all thereportsand/*dashboards*/you can see in the current organization.
/+ On all the tables: /+
  • The column/*score/*is calculated based on the following rules
-If the item has no description, then you get +1. ;/ -/ /-By default, the table is ordered by descending Score, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ :/ /+

labels.shortDescription: Title of the Apex tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Apex tab in OrgCheck
Description / Help text of the Apex tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page lists all your Apex Classes and Triggers in three tabs:
  • The first tab called/* Classes */is a tabular list of all the Apex Classes in this org.
    • /- The second tab called/* Triggers */is a tabular list of all Apex Triggers in this org. -/ /- The third tab called/* Object's triggers count */is a grouped table that aggregates all triggers per objects in this org. -/
/+ To make sure you get/* all the benefits */from this page, make sure to follow these steps:
    /- You/* compile all classes */by selecting the "Plug" button. -/ /- You/* run all tests */by selecting the "Like" button. -/
/+

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Apex tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
On the Classes table:
  • The column score is calculated based on the following rules
- If the class is not used by any other entity (based on the Dependency API), then you get +1. /- If the API version of the class is older than 3 year, then you get +1.-/ /- If the class needs recompilation, then you get +1.-/ /- If the class is not explicitely specifying the sharing, then you get +1.-/ /- If the class has not reached a code covergare of/* 85% */ , then you get +1. -/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ /- If the item has dependencies, you can click on the link "Dependencies" to get a graphical view of where it is used and what it is using. -/ :/ /+

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Apex tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
On the Triggers table:
  • The column score is calculated based on the following rules
- If the trigger is not used by any other entity (based on the Dependency API), then you get +1. /- If the API version of the trigger is older than 3 year, then you get +1.-/ /- If the trigger is inactive, then you get +1.-/ /- If the trigger is more than 5,000 characters long, then you get +1.-/ /- If the trigger is containing SOQL or DML statments, then you get +1.-/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ /- If the item has dependencies, you can click on the link "Dependencies" to get a graphical view of where it is used and what it is using. -/ :/ /+

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Apex tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
On the Triggers per object table:
  • The column score is calculated based on the following rules
- If the count of active triggers per object is greater that one, you get +1. ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ :/

labels.shortDescription: Title of the Automations tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Automations tab in OrgCheck
labels.value: Workflows, Process Builders and Flows Overview

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Automations tab in OrgCheck
Title of the Batches tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Batches tab in OrgCheck
Description / Help text of the Batches tab in OrgCheck
Title of the Custom Fields tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Custom Fields tab in OrgCheck
Description / Help text of the Custom Fields tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page lists all your custom fields and not the standard fields.
/+ On this table : /+
  • Each row represents a custom field
    • /- The column/* score */is calculated based on the following rules
- If the field has no description, then you get +1. -/ /- If the field is not used by any other entity (based on the Dependency API), then you get +1. -/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ /- If the field has dependencies, you can click on the link "Dependencies" to get a graphical view of where it isused and what it is using. -/ :/

labels.shortDescription: Title of the Custom Labels tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Custom Labels tab in OrgCheck
Description / Help text of the Custom Labels tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page lists all your custom labels .
/+ On this table: /+
  • Each row represents a custom label
    • /- The column/* score */is calculated based on the following rules
- If the custom label is not used by any other entity (based on the Dependency API), then you get +1 -/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ /- If the field has dependencies, you can click on the link "Dependencies" to get a graphical view of where it isused and what it is using. -/ :/

labels.shortDescription: Title of the Objects tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Objects tab in OrgCheck
Description / Help text of the Objects tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page gives you an overview of your Objects in two tabs:
  • The first tab called/* Object Documentation */is giving you the entire documentatio of a specified object
    • /- The second tab called/* Org Wide Default */is a tabular list of the internal and external sharing for all your objects -/
/+

labels.shortDescription: Title of the Profiles and Permission Sets tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Profiles and Permission Sets tab in OrgCheck
labels.value: Non User Specific Profile and Permissions Overview

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Profiles and Permission Sets tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page lists all your Profiles and Permission Sets in five tabs:
  • The first tab called/* Profiles */is giving you a tabular list of all the profiles in this Org
    • /- The second tab called/* Permission Sets */is giving you a tabular list of all the permission sets and permission set groups in this Org -/ /- The third tab called/* Login Hours Restrictions */is extracting the login hour restrictions from all the profiles at once -/ /- The fourth tab called/* IP Range Restrictions */is extracting the IP Range restrictions from all the profiles at once -/ /- The fifth tab called/* Object CRUDs */(beta) is showing the rights (Create, Read, Update, Delete) on Objects for profiles and permission sets -/
/+

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Profiles and Permission Sets tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
On the profiles table:
  • Each row represents a profile which can be custom or standard
    • /- The column score is calculated based on the following rules
- If it is custom and is not used by any active users, then you get +1. -/ /- If it is custom and has no description, then you get +1. -/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ :/ /+

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Profiles and Permission Sets tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
On the permission sets table:
  • Each row represents a permissio set or a permission set group
    • /- The column score is calculated based on the following rules
- If it is custom and is not used by any active users, then you get +1. -/ /- If it is custom and has no description, then you get +1. -/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ :/ /+ At this time, the Object CRUDs are shown as a beta feature that needs to be activated on the Home tab of this application. /+ We did this to make sure this feature is not slowing you down./+ In the future, you will be able to select either the object(s) or the profile(s)/permission set(s). /+

labels.shortDescription: Title of the Public Groups tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Public Groups tab in OrgCheck
Description / Help text of the Public Groups tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page lists all your Public Groups and Queues in two tabs:
  • The first tab called/* Public Groups */is giving you a tabular list of all the public groups in this Org
    • /- The second tab called/* Queues */is giving you a tabular list of all the queues in this Org -/
/+ The secret sauce in the page is the column called/* All Active Users */which is calculated recurcively across all possible sub meta-groups (role, role and subordinates, groups, etc.) that are contained in the groups or queues. /+ /+

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Public Groups tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
On the public groups table:
  • Each row represents a public group
    • /- The column score is calculated based on the following rules
- If the public group contains no active user at all (see All Active Users column), then you get +1. -/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ :/ /+ On the queues table: /+ /:/- Each row represents a queue -/ /- The column/* score */is calculated based on the following rules:
    /- If the queue contains no active user at all (see All Active Users column), then you get +1. -/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ :/ /+

labels.shortDescription: Title of the Roles tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Roles tab in OrgCheck
Description / Help text of the Roles tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page illustrates your Role Hierarchy in two tabs:
  • The first tab called/* Role Explorer */is showing a graphical view of your role hierarchy
    • /- The second tab called/* Role Listing */is a tabular list of the corresponding data. -/
/+ Too many levels in your role hierarchy can lead to bad performance (including sharing calculation)./+ That is why we are giving you an alert if your hierarchy uses more that/* 7 levels */ . /+ /+

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Roles tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
On the graphical view:
  • Each box represents a/* role */that are linked to each other following their parent role.
    • /- The/* yellow */boxes represent roles without any active users -/ /- The/* blue */boxes represent roles with active users -/ /- On each box, you can see/* bubbles */in their upper right corner -/ /- The/* blue */bubbles represent the number of active users (if more than 100 we put 99+) -/ /- The/* grey */bubbles represent the number of inactive users (if more than 100 we put 99+) -/ /- You can click on each box to get more details about the corresponding role. -/
/+

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Roles tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
On the tabular table view:
  • Each row represents a role
    • /- The column score is calculated based on the following rules
- If the role contains no active user, then you get +1. -/ /- If the role contains more than one inactive user, then you get +1. -/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ :/

labels.shortDescription: Title of the Users tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Users tab in OrgCheck
labels.value: Active Users Profile and Permissions Overview

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Users tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page lists all your active users in the organization.
/+ On this table : /+
  • Each row represents an active user
    • /- The column/* score */is calculated based on the following rules
- If the user is not using Lightning Experience, then you get +1. -/ /- If the user never logged, , then you get +1. -/ ;/-/ /- The column/* Key Permission */is focused on important permissions such as Api Enabled, View Setup,Modify All Data and View All Data. -/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ :/

labels.shortDescription: Title of the Visual Components tab in OrgCheck
Subtitle of the Visual Components tab in OrgCheck
Description / Help text of the Visual Components tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
This page lists all your Visual Components in five tabs:
  • The first tab called/* Visual Force Pages */is a tabular list of all the VF pages in this org.
    • /- The second tab called/* Visual Force Components */is a tabular list of all VF components in this org. -/ /- The third tab called/* Lightning Pages */is a tabular list of all the Lightning pages (aka Flexi Pages for the ones that are deploying) in this org. -/ /- The fourth tab called/* Lightning Aura Components */is a tabular list of all the Aura Components in this org. -/ /- The fifth tab called/* Lightning Web Components */is a tabular list of all the LWC in this org. -/
/+

labels.shortDescription: Description / Help text of the Visual Components tab in OrgCheck
labels.value:
On all the tables:
  • The column score is calculated based on the following rules
- If the item is not used by any other entity (based on the Dependency API), then you get +1. /- When applicable, if the API version used by the item is older than three year, then you get +1.-/ /- If the item has no description, then you get +1. -/ ;/-/ /- By default, the table is ordered by Score descending, in other words the biggest scores come first. -/ /- If the item has dependencies, you can click on the link "Dependencies" to get a graphical view of where it is used and what it is using. -/ :/ /+
